div.p: Jasmine is a small JavaScript testing DOM-less framework. It is a successor of JsUnit and it can be downloaded and published on a server to execute test runners. Also, it can be executed through its Ruby gem, which makes it easier to use for continuous integration.
Note: You must install the Ruby environment as well as the Jasmine gem and its dependencies (rake, rack, win32console, rspec, selenium-rc).

p.br: This plugin was developed and tested with Jasmine version 1.0.1.

div.p: You do not need to configure the plugin before using it.
See the Commander online help system for details about how to use this plugin within a procedure.
When you provide information for this plugin, fill-in the fields as follows:

ul.li: Rakefile location - Provide the absolute path to the rakefile that contains the Jasmine tasks to be executed.
Type of execution - Select the target to execute for the Rake invocation, either jasmine or jasmine:ci for default and Selenium modes, respectively.
Additional Rake Commands - Provide any additional commands to execute for Rake.
Working directory - Indicate the desired working directory. Leave blank to use the default workspace.
